@graph.name: Butternut Squash Mac and Cheese
@graph.description: Kids and adults alike will swoon for this Butternut Squash Mac and Cheese! The sauce is so creamy and smooth with no dairy at all. Gluten free option.
recipeIngredient: 1  pound diced butternut squash (about 4 cups chopped)*
16 ounces pasta of choice, I used little shells
Optional, for serving:  thawed frozen peas, cooked kale, or roasted broccoli

itemListElement.text: If using a fresh whole squash, peel and cut the squash into cubes. Measure about 4 cups (1 pound).
itemListElement.name: If using a fresh whole squash, peel and cut the squash into cubes. Measure about 4 cups (1 pound).

itemListElement.text: To cook in an Instant Pot: Add the squash and 2-3 cups of water, to cover, to your Instant Pot and cook on high pressure for 8 minutes. Carefully release the pressure and drain the squash.
itemListElement.name: To cook in an Instant Pot: Add the squash and 2-3 cups of water, to cover, to your Instant Pot and cook on high pressure for 8 minutes. Carefully release the pressure and drain the squash.

itemListElement.text: To cook on the stovetop: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then add the butternut squash cubes. Simmer for about 10-12 minutes, until the squash is fork tender. Drain.
itemListElement.name: To cook on the stovetop: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then add the butternut squash cubes. Simmer for about 10-12 minutes, until the squash is fork tender. Drain.

itemListElement.text: Cook the pasta according to package instructions, being careful not to overcook. Drain and add the noodles back to the pot.
itemListElement.name: Cook the pasta according to package instructions, being careful not to overcook. Drain and add the noodles back to the pot.

itemListElement.text: In a high powered blender, add the cooked butternut squash along with the cashews, 2 cups of water, cornstarch, nutritional yeast, dijon, garlic powder, onion powder, lemon juice and salt. Blend until very smooth.
itemListElement.name: In a high powered blender, add the cooked butternut squash along with the cashews, 2 cups of water, cornstarch, nutritional yeast, dijon, garlic powder, onion powder, lemon juice and salt. Blend until very smooth.

itemListElement.text: Add the cheese sauce to the pot with the cooked noodles. Stir constantly over low-medium heat for a minute or two until the sauce thickens a bit. Serve immediately.
